components.description: A large minus symbol, as used in mathematics.
components.title: Heavy Minus Sign

description: A large minus symbol, as used in mathematics.
title: Heavy Minus Sign

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Dingbats -> Heavy variants of arithmetic symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: Heavy Minus Sign was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015. Copy and paste this emoji: Copy http://emojipedia.org/heavy-minus-sign/
emoji_net_data.name: heavy minus sign

bn:00094409v: Straighten up or out; make straight
To cease to be bent; to become straight or relaxed.

bn:00086432v: To take one thing from another.
To take one thing from another; remove from; make smaller by some amount.

bn:00014689n: Deliberate process that transforms inputs to outputs with variable change
The act, process or result of calculating.
A calculation is a deliberate process that transforms one or more inputs into one or more results, with variable change.
The act or process of computing; calculation; reckoning.
Problem solving that involves numbers or quantities
The act or process of calculating.
The act or process of computing.

bn:00055233n: An arithmetic operation in which the difference between two numbers is calculated
The plus and minus signs are mathematical symbols used to represent the notions of positive and negative as well as the operations of addition and subtraction.
Subtraction is a mathematical operation that represents the operation of removing objects from a collection.
Mathematical symbols used to represent the notions of positive and negative as well as the operations of addition and subtraction
An elementary arithmetic operation that is the opposite of addition.

bn:00053450n: A perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent (as a visible clue that something has happened)
A perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent, as a visible clue that something has happened.

bn:00053823n: Mathematics is the study of topics such as quantity, structure, space, and change.
The application of principles associated with Cavalieri's principle.
The science that deals with concepts such as quantity, structure, space and change.
An abstract representational system used in the study of numbers, shapes, structure, change and the relationships between these concepts.
A science (or group of related sciences) dealing with the logic of quantity and shape and arrangement
Mathematics is the body of knowledge centered on concepts such as quantity, structure, space, and change, and the academic discipline which studies them.
Abstract study of numbers, quantity, structure, relationships, etc.

apple_vendor_description: The minus emoji on Apple devices is a clean, crisp horizontal line rendered in a deep, sophisticated gray with subtle 3D shading that gives it a tangible feel. Its perfectly straight form and soft, rounded ends are typical of Apple's minimalist yet polished aesthetic, symbolizing subtraction, reduction, or negation. This straightforward symbol is commonly used in mathematical contexts or to indicate a decrease or absence in digital communication.
